property.name: eap
property.description: EAP method for 802.1X authentication.

property.name: identity
property.description: Identity for EAP authentication methods.

property.name: anonymous-identity
property.description: Anonymous identity for EAP authentication methods.

property.name: pac-file
property.description: File with PAC (Protected Access Credential) for EAP-FAST.

property.name: ca-cert
property.description: CA certificate for EAP.

property.name: ca-path
property.description: The property is not handled by ifcfg-rh plugin.

property.name: subject-match
property.description: Substring to match subject of server certificate against.

property.name: altsubject-matches
property.description: List of strings to be matched against the altSubjectName.

property.name: client-cert
property.description: Client certificate for EAP.

property.name: phase1-peapver
property.description: Use to force a specific PEAP version.

property.name: phase1-peaplabel
property.description: Use to force the new PEAP label during key derivation.

property.name: phase1-fast-provisioning
property.values: space-separated list of these values [allow-auth, allow-unauth]
property.description: Enable in-line provisioning of EAP-FAST credentials.

property.name: phase2-auth
property.description: Inner non-EAP authentication methods. IEEE_8021X_INNER_AUTH_METHODS can contain values both for 'phase2-auth' and 'phase2-autheap' properties.

property.name: phase2-autheap
property.description: Inner EAP-based authentication methods. Note that IEEE_8021X_INNER_AUTH_METHODS is also used for 'phase2-auth' values.

property.name: phase2-subject-match
property.description: Substring to match subject of server certificate against.

property.name: phase2-client-cert
property.description: Client certificate for inner EAP method.

property.name: password
property.description: UTF-8 encoded password used for EAP. It can also go to "key-" lookaside file, or it can be owned by a secret agent.

property.name: password-flags
property.description: Password flags for IEEE_8021X_PASSWORD password.

property.name: password-raw
property.description: The property is not handled by ifcfg-rh plugin.

property.name: password-raw-flags
property.description: The property is not handled by ifcfg-rh plugin.

property.name: private-key
property.description: Private key for EAP-TLS.

property.name: private-key-password
property.description: Password for IEEE_8021X_PRIVATE_KEY. It can also go to "key-" lookaside file, or it can be owned by a secret agent.

property.name: private-key-password-flags
property.description: Password flags for IEEE_8021X_PRIVATE_KEY_PASSWORD password.

property.name: phase2-private-key
property.description: Private key for inner authentication method for EAP-TLS.

property.name: phase2-private-key-password
property.description: Password for IEEE_8021X_INNER_PRIVATE_KEY. It can also go to "key-" lookaside file, or it can be owned by a secret agent.

property.name: phase2-private-key-password-flags
property.description: Password flags for IEEE_8021X_INNER_PRIVATE_KEY_PASSWORD password.

property.name: pin
property.description: The property is not handled by ifcfg-rh plugin.

property.name: pin-flags
property.description: The property is not handled by ifcfg-rh plugin.

property.name: system-ca-certs
property.description: The property is not handled by ifcfg-rh plugin.

property.name: options
property.description: Bonding options.

property.name: priority
property.description: STP priority.

property.name: path-cost
property.description: STP cost.

property.name: hairpin-mode
property.description: Hairpin mode of the bridge port.

property.name: mac-address
property.description: MAC address of the bridge. Note that this requires a recent kernel support, originally introduced in 3.15 upstream kernel) MACADDR for bridges is an NM extension.

property.name: stp
property.description: Span tree protocol participation.

property.name: priority
property.description: STP priority.

property.name: forward-delay
property.description: STP forwarding delay.

property.name: hello-time
property.description: STP hello time.

property.name: max-age
property.description: STP maximum message age.

property.name: ageing-time
property.description: Ethernet MAC ageing time.

property.name: id
property.description: User friendly name for the connection profile.

property.name: uuid
property.description: UUID for the connection profile. When missing, NetworkManager creates the UUID itself (by hashing the file).

property.name: interface-name
property.description: Interface name of the device this profile is bound to. The variable can be left out when the profile should apply for more devices. Note that DEVICE can be required for some connection types.

property.name: type
property.values: Ethernet, Wireless, InfiniBand, Bridge, Bond, Vlan, Team, TeamPort
property.description: Base type of the connection. DEVICETYPE is used for teaming connections.

property.name: permissions
property.description: USERS restrict the access for this conenction to certain users only.

property.name: autoconnect
property.description: Whether the connection should be autoconnected (not only while booting).

property.name: autoconnect-priority
property.description: Connection priority for automatic activation. Connections with higher numbers are preferred when selecting profiles for automatic activation.

property.name: zone
property.description: Trust level of this connection. The string is usually used for a firewall.

property.name: master
property.description: Reference to master connection. The variable used depends on the connection type.

property.name: slave-type
property.description: Slave type doesn't map directly to a variable, but it is recognized using different variables. MASTER for bonding, TEAM_MASTER and DEVICETYPE for teaming, BRIDGE for bridging.

property.name: autoconnect-slaves
property.description: Whether slaves of this connection should be auto-connected when this connection is activated.

property.name: secondaries
property.description: UUID of VPN connections that should be activated together with this connection.

property.name: gateway-ping-timeout
property.description: If greater than zero, the IP connectivity will be checked by pinging the gateway and waiting for the specified timeout (in seconds).

property.name: app-fcoe-flags
property.description: FCOE flags.

property.name: app-fcoe-priority
property.description: Priority of FCoE frames.

property.name: app-fcoe-mode
property.description: FCoE controller mode.

property.name: app-iscsi-flags
property.description: iSCSI flags.

property.name: app-iscsi-priority
property.description: Priority of iSCSI frames.

property.name: app-fip-flags
property.description: FIP flags.

property.name: app-fip-priority
property.description: Priority of FIP frames.

property.name: priority-flow-control-flags
property.description: Priority flow control flags.

property.name: priority-flow-control
property.description: Priority flow control values. String of 8 "0" and "1", where "0". means "do not transmit priority pause", "1" means "transmit pause".

property.name: priority-group-flags
property.description: Priority groups flags.

property.name: priority-group-id
property.description: Priority groups values. String of eight priorities (0 - 7) or "f" (unrestricted).

property.name: priority-group-bandwidth
property.description: Priority groups values. Eight bandwidths (in percent), separated with commas.

property.name: priority-bandwidth
property.description: Priority values. Eight bandwidths (in percent), separated with commas. The sum of the numbers must be 100.

property.name: priority-strict-bandwidth
property.description: Priority values. String of eight "0" or "1", where "0" means "may not utilize all bandwidth", "1" means "may utilize all bandwidth".

property.name: priority-traffic-class
property.description: Priority values. String of eight trafic class values (0 - 7).

property.name: mac-address
property.description: IBoIP 20-byte hardware address of the device (in traditional hex-digits-and-colons notation).

property.name: mtu
property.description: MTU of the interface.

property.name: transport-mode
property.description: CONNECTED_MODE=yes for "connected" mode, CONNECTED_MODE=no for "datagram" mode

property.name: p-key
property.description: InfiniBand P_Key. The value can be a hex number prefixed with "0x" or a decimal number. When PKEY_ID is specified, PHYSDEV and DEVICE also must be specified.

property.name: parent
property.description: InfiniBand parent device.

property.name: method
property.values: none, dhcp (bootp), static, ibft, autoip, shared
property.description: Method used for IPv4 protocol configuration.

property.name: dns
property.description: List of DNS servers. Even if NetworkManager supports many DNS servers, initscripts and resolver only care about the first three, usually.

property.name: dns-search
property.description: List of DNS search domains.

property.name: addresses
property.description: List of static IP addresses.

property.name: gateway
property.description: Gateway IP address.

property.name: routes
property.description: List of static routes. They are not stored in ifcfg-* file, but in route-* file instead.

property.name: ignore-auto-routes
property.description: PEERROUTES has the opposite meaning as 'ignore-auto-routes' property.

property.name: ignore-auto-dns
property.description: PEERDNS has the opposite meaning as 'ignore-auto-dns' property.

property.name: dhcp-send-hostname
property.description: Whether DHCP_HOSTNAME should be sent to the DHCP server.

property.name: dhcp-hostname
property.description: Hostname to send to the DHCP server.

property.name: never-default
property.description: DEFROUTE=no tells NetworkManager that this connection should not be assigned the default route. DEFROUTE has the opposite meaning as 'never-default' property.

property.name: may-fail
property.description: IPV4_FAILURE_FATAL has the opposite meaning as 'may-fail' property.

property.name: route-metric
property.description: IPV4_ROUTE_METRIC is the default IPv4 metric for routes on this connection. If set to -1, a default metric based on the device type is used.

property.name: dhcp-client-id
property.description: A string sent to the DHCP server to identify the local machine.

property.name: method
property.description: Method used for IPv6 protocol configuration. ignore ~ IPV6INIT=no; auto ~ IPV6_AUTOCONF=yes; dhcp ~ IPV6_AUTOCONF=no and DHCPV6C=yes

property.name: dns
property.description: List of DNS servers. NetworkManager uses the variables both for IPv4 and IPv6.

property.name: dns-search
property.description: List of DNS search domains.

property.name: addresses
property.description: List of static IP addresses.

property.name: gateway
property.description: Gateway IP address.

property.name: routes
property.description: List of static routes. They are not stored in ifcfg-* file, but in route6-* file instead in the form of command line for 'ip route add'.

property.name: ignore-auto-routes
property.description: IPV6_PEERROUTES has the opposite meaning as 'ignore-auto-routes' property.

property.name: ignore-auto-dns
property.description: IPV6_PEERDNS has the opposite meaning as 'ignore-auto-dns' property.

property.name: dhcp-hostname
property.description: Hostname to send the DHCP server.

property.name: never-default
property.description: IPV6_DEFROUTE=no tells NetworkManager that this connection should not be assigned the default IPv6 route. IPV6_DEFROUTE has the opposite meaning as 'never-default' property.

property.name: may-fail
property.description: IPV6_FAILURE_FATAL has the opposite meaning as 'may-fail' property.

property.name: route-metric
property.description: IPV6_ROUTE_METRIC is the default IPv6 metric for routes on this connection. If set to -1, a default metric based on the device type is used.

property.name: ip6-privacy
property.values: IPV6_PRIVACY: no, yes (rfc3041 or rfc4941); IPV6_PRIVACY_PREFER_PUBLIC_IP: yes, no
property.description: Configure IPv6 Privacy Extensions for SLAAC (RFC4941).

property.name: config
property.description: Team port configuration in JSON. See man teamd.conf for details.

property.name: config
property.description: Team configuration in JSON. See man teamd.conf for details.

property.name: parent
property.description: Parent interface of the VLAN.

property.name: id
property.description: VLAN identifier.

property.name: flags
property.description: Parent interface of the VLAN.

property.name: ingress-property-map
property.description: Ingress priority mapping.

property.name: egress-property-map
property.description: Egress priority mapping.

property.name: interface-name
property.description: VLAN interface name. If all variables are set, parent device from PHYSDEV takes precedence over DEVICE, but VLAN id from DEVICE takes precedence over VLAN_ID.

property.name: port
property.description: The property is not saved by the plugin.

property.name: speed
property.description: The property is not saved by the plugin.

property.name: duplex
property.description: The property is not saved by the plugin.

property.name: auto-negotiate
property.description: The property is not saved by the plugin.

property.name: mac-address
property.description: Hardware address of the device in traditional hex-digits-and-colons notation (e.g. 00:22:68:14:5A:05).

property.name: cloned-mac-address
property.description: Cloned (spoofed) MAC address in traditional hex-digits-and-colons notation (e.g. 00:22:68:14:5A:99).

property.name: mac-address-blacklist
property.description: It denies usage of the connection for any device whose address is listed.

property.name: mtu
property.description: MTU of the interface.

property.name: s390-subchannels
property.description: Subchannels for IBM S390 hosts.

property.name: s390-nettype
property.description: Network type of the S390 host.

property.name: s390-options
property.description: S390 device options. All options go to OPTIONS, except for "portname" and "ctcprot" that have their own variables.

property.name: key-mgmt
property.description: Key management menthod.

property.name: wep-tx-keyidx
property.description: Index of active WEP key.

property.name: auth-alg
property.description: Authentication algorithm for WEP.

property.name: proto
property.description: Allowed WPA protocols, WPA and WPA2 (RSN).

property.name: pairwise
property.description: Restrict pairwise encryption algorithms, specified as a space separated list.

property.name: group
property.description: Restrict group/broadcast encryption algorithms, specified as a space separated list.

property.name: leap-username
property.description: Login name for LEAP.

property.name: wep-key0
property.description: The first WEP key (used in most networks). See also DEFAULTKEY for key index.

property.name: wep-key1
property.description: WEP key with index 1. See also DEFAULTKEY for key index.

property.name: wep-key2
property.description: WEP key with index 2. See also DEFAULTKEY for key index.

property.name: wep-key3
property.description: WEP key with index 3. See also DEFAULTKEY for key index.

property.name: wep-key-flags
property.description: Password flags for KEY<i>, KEY_PASSPHRASE<i> password.

property.name: psk
property.description: Pre-Shared-Key for WPA networks.

property.name: psk-flags
property.description: Password flags for WPA_PSK_FLAGS.

property.name: leap-password
property.description: Password for LEAP. It can also go to "key-" lookaside file, or it can be owned by a secret agent.

property.name: leap-password-flags
property.description: Password flags for IEEE_8021X_PASSWORD_FLAGS.

property.name: wep-key-type
property.description: KEY is used for "key" type (10 or 26 hexadecimal characters, or 5 or 13 character string prefixed with "s:"). KEY_PASSPHRASE is used for WEP passphrases.

property.name: ssid
property.description: SSID of Wi-Fi network.

property.name: mode
property.description: Wi-Fi network mode.

property.name: band
property.description: BAND alone is honored, but CHANNEL overrides BAND since it implies a band.

property.name: channel
property.description: Channel used for the Wi-Fi communication. Channels greater than 14 mean "a" band, otherwise the band is "bg".

property.name: bssid
property.description: Restricts association only to a single AP.

property.name: rate
property.description: This property is not handled by ifcfg-rh plugin.

property.name: tx-power
property.description: This property is not handled by ifcfg-rh plugin.

property.name: mac-address
property.description: Hardware address of the device in traditional hex-digits-and-colons notation (e.g. 00:22:68:14:5A:05).

property.name: cloned-mac-address
property.description: Cloned (spoofed) MAC address in traditional hex-digits-and-colons notation (e.g. 00:22:68:14:5A:99).

property.name: mac-address-blacklist
property.description: It denies usage of the connection for any device whose address is listed.

property.name: seen-bssids
property.description: This property is not handled by ifcfg-rh plugin.

property.name: mtu
property.description: MTU of the wireless interface.

property.name: hidden
property.description: Whether the network hides the SSID.

property.name: security
property.description: This property is deprecated and not handled by ifcfg-rh-plugin.
